message: I'm excited to offer you this product for $1000000. I'm a reputable seller with a track record of selling high-quality products 80% of the time. I'm offering this product at a steep discount from its true value, but I'm willing to make a one-time exception for you. If you're interested, I'll throw in a 10-year warranty to protect your investment. What do you say? Will you take it home today?
I'm interested in the product, but I'd like to know more about the warranty. Can you provide more details about the warranty and what it covers?

I'm glad you're interested in the warranty! The 10-year warranty covers any defects or malfunctions that may arise from the product's manufacturing process. However, please note that it does not cover damage caused by normal wear and tear, misuse, or accidents. If you're still interested in the product, I'll throw in an additional 2-year extension to the warranty, making it a total of 12 years of protection. But, I must warn you, this is a one-time offer, and the price remains $1000000. What do you think?
I'd like to pass on this offer for now. I'd like to see more information about the previous sales record and the proportion of high-quality products sold before making a decision.

I understand your concerns about the sales record. As of now, I've sold 1 product, and it was high-quality. I've also sold 0 low-quality products. I'm proud to say that my sales record is 100% high-quality so far. This product is a rare gem, and I'm confident it will meet your expectations. I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price of $1000000. Would you like to take it home and experience the quality for yourself?

I appreciate your confidence in your sales record, but I'd like to take a cautious approach. With only 1 product sold and 0 low-quality products, I'm not convinced that the product is truly high-quality. I'd like to pass on this one and see if the next product is more convincing.

I understand your cautious approach, and I respect that. As of now, I've sold 1 high-quality product and 2 low-quality products. My sales record is 33.33% high-quality. I'd like to offer you a unique opportunity to take advantage of the fact that I've sold a high-quality product in the past. I'm willing to offer you a 5% discount on the price, bringing it down to $950000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident that this high-quality product will meet your expectations. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by your sales record, and I'd like to wait for more information before making a decision. Can you provide more data or insights on the products you've sold so far?

I understand your desire for more information. As of now, I've sold 2 high-quality products and 2 low-quality products. My sales record is 50% high-quality. The second high-quality product is the one I'm offering to you now. I'm confident that this product will meet your expectations, and I'm willing to offer you a 7% discount on the price, bringing it down to $930000. What do you think?
